Moon landing 1969: The Apollo 11 mission landed the first humans on the Moon on July 20, 1969.
Fall of Berlin Wall: The Berlin Wall fell on November 9, 1989, symbolizing the end of the Cold War.
Invention of the Internet: ARPANET, the precursor to the modern internet, was created in 1969 and expanded into the internet by the 1980s.
First Powered Flight 1903: The Wright brothers made the first powered flight on December 17, 1903 in Kitty Hawk, North Carolina.
French Revolution 1789: The French Revolution began in 1789, leading to the rise of democracy and the fall of the monarchy in France.
Discovery of Penicillin: Alexander Fleming discovered penicillin in 1928, paving the way for antibiotics.
Signing of the US Declaration of Indepen: The Declaration of Independence was signed on July 4, 1776, marking the United States' independence from Britain.
Launch of Sputnik 1957: The Soviet Union launched Sputnik 1 on October 4, 1957, the first artificial satellite.
Magna Carta 1215: The Magna Carta was signed in 1215, laying foundations for constitutional governance.
Industrial Revolution: The Industrial Revolution began in Britain in the late 18th century, transforming manufacturing and society.
